description: The head of American Rising Squared says it monitors the liberal activist at public events only.
title: Tracking Bill McKibben
title_page: Opinion | Tracking Bill McKibben - The New York Times
maintext:
To the Editor:
Re “My Right-Wing Stalkers,” by Bill McKibben (Op-Ed, Aug. 7):
Mr. McKibben implies that my group, America Rising Squared, would somehow monitor his family at nonpublic events such as at a funeral or at an airport. Not so. We are simply trying to bring transparency to a leading public figure and liberal activist who played a key role in writing the Democratic Party’s 2016 platform.
Video tracking was pioneered by liberal activists and is now such standard practice across the political spectrum that Mr. McKibben’s own organization, 350.org, conducts “boot camps,” training activists to do it.
My group tracks only campaign-style events that are open to the public. Our footage of Mr. McKibben in a church pew was taken at an open political forum, not a religious service.
Given Mr. McKibben’s offensive rhetoric — saying a proper response to 9/11 would have been a $1 gas tax, for example — it is understandable why he would be uncomfortable with close scrutiny.
